text:
<https://is.gd/k1jvzz>
Why should you care whether you are designing for a buyer or a user persona? Because for those, who knows the value of smooth customer experience, it changes everything.

In large companies, if someone buys a service, that doesn’t necessarily mean that they will also use it. And vice versa: those who leverage your product on a daily basis are less likely to be the ones who signed the contract. What a plot twist, hah?

If this information just blew your mind – our article is definitely for you. If it didn’t – still worth checking out. Because at least have you seen our awesome buyer and user persona templates? No? Then you definitely should!

text: Hi y'all! I hope you're having an amazing day. Can you spare a couple of minutes to fill out a *quick content strategy survey* form? I'm in the process of research and would love to get your response if you're a CMO, head of content, or VP of marketing. <https://forms.gle/yLutNSbm7Tj6YPYn8>

attachments.text: I appreciate you taking the time to share your thoughts — and your feedback means a hella lot. I urge you to go beyond one-word answers and be as detailed and specific as possible. Disclaimer: This is solely for the purpose of research. No shady pitches, I promise. :)
attachments.title: Content Strategy Survey

text:
Are you using *cohort analysis* to boost your strategy:question:
Here’s a <https://croct.com/blog/post/cohorts-marketing?utm_medium=community&utm_source=slack&utm_campaign=20220407.PO.BL.cohorts|blog post> on

• How to use cohorts analysis to reduce churn
• Why are cohorts different from segments
• What are the differences between cohort analysis and churn analysis

attachments.fallback: Croct Blog: What are cohorts, and how can we use them in marketing?
attachments.text: Although cohorts are widely used for research studies on health and society, you don't need to be a scientist to have it a great help in reducing churn. Here you'll find comparisons with other audience analysis methods, the main metrics you should track, and a few meaningful examples.
attachments.title: What are cohorts, and how can we use them in marketing?

elements.text: How to use cohorts analysis to reduce churn
Why are cohorts different from segments

text:
:earth_americas: I've started recommending most businesses adopt an outsourced model when it comes to SEO & content. Unless you currently (or plan to) have >30% of the traffic to your website come from organic, then I suggest that folks talk with awesome freelancers and agencies.

IMO, common businesses that should strongly consider outsourced work include local businesses (plumbing services, local attraction), small SaaS or mobile apps (only targeting a handful of keywords), and digital service providers (only capable of offering a handful of services).

There are a lot of dangers of going outsourced though. How can you guarantee work consistency? What can you expect from an engagement? We'll cover all of this and more with guest speaker <@U034H601T7X>, founder of <http://GetCredo.com|GetCredo.com> and <http://EditorNinja.com|EditorNinja.com>, for the next Clearscope webinar on "Should You Hire In-House or Outsource Your SEO & Content Work?".

:spiral_note_pad: *Details:*
** Title:* Should You Hire In-House or Outsource Your SEO & Content Work?
** Speakers:* <https://clearscope.us6.list-manage.com/track/click?u=007c9261dfa84f8983bd7d6de&id=86f53c83ce&e=646b32ed2c|John Doherty>, Founder of <https://clearscope.us6.list-manage.com/track/click?u=007c9261dfa84f8983bd7d6de&id=3c78e707a5&e=646b32ed2c|Credo> & <https://clearscope.us6.list-manage.com/track/click?u=007c9261dfa84f8983bd7d6de&id=3a9a032f01&e=646b32ed2c|EditorNinja>
** Date & time:* Thursday, April 14th, 11:00 AM US Central Time
** Zoom registration page:* <https://us02web.zoom.us/webinar/register/3316492597467/WN_3QyzND1pQYCC9HRxNORpeQ>
** Who should attend:* Attend this webinar for insights on the pros & cons of hiring in-house vs outsourcing.

RSVP to attend live OR receive the webinar recording in your inbox if you can't make it :inbox_tray:

Happy Thursday, all! Are you looking for ABM/ABX certifications for you/your team as a way to up-level your skillsets? I wanted to let you know of a few options that we have that you might not know about:

We have 3 courses (<https://learn.demandbase.com/abm-certification-foundations-course|ABM Foundations>, <https://learn.demandbase.com/abm-certification-advanced-course|ABM Advanced>, <https://your.demandbase.com/resources/blog/abx-certificate-free|ABX Certification>), all $349 each BUT I have promo codes that will allow you to take the course for *free*.

If you'd like the codes to any of the courses, just lemme know!
